item.title: Internal: Content and performance summary dashboards, and weekly summary email
item.description:
Uberflip has created 3 resources (built in Looker) to help users consume analytics data more passively. This includes 2 Looker dashboards, and 1 weekly metrics summary email. 

These are available for CSMs and other Uberflippers to offer to users who they think will benefit. 

This article explains the value of the 3 Looker resources, and how to activate the weekly email. Standard Looker processes will allow you to add the 2 dashboards to Uberflip accounts.

Tip

The summary dashboards are great for finding content with comparable outlier stats. These oddities often point to actionable change.
Examples: 

  • High time-on-page, but low page-views? Could be a high value Item that’s too hidden. 
    Try: Feature the Item, or move it to a more prominent spot in the Stream/Hub. 
  • High page-views, but low time-on-page? May be a high-value topic, but the content isn’t what the viewer expected. 
    Try: Keep the title, but rework the content based on that title, and what the reader likely wanted.
  • Low time-on-page, but high Flipbook-downloads? May be high value piece visitors want to download and read later.
    Try: Gate the Flipbook to see if this high value asset can help generate leads.

Weekly summary email explained

For users who would benefit from a more passive way to consume basic UFA stats, the weekly summary email is a great option.

This email gives a brief overview of some key metrics found in UFA, including: 

  • Target Audience stats
  • Audience Quality stats
  • CTA Conversion rates 
  • Top 5 New Prospects (when 6sense is enabled) 

The data summary is for the last completed week (Monday - Sunday).

Enable the weekly summary email for users

The weekly summary email is actually a pre-built dashboard that is available in all Uberflip accounts. You’ll just need to set the dashboard for email delivery within a user's account. Here’s how: 

  1. From Admin, go into the user's account
  2. Go to Uberflip Analytics
  3. Click the Folders icon 
  4. Click Shared > Dashboards for Distribution > Weekly Newsletter
  5. Click the kebab menu (three vertical dots)
  6. Click Schedule Delivery. The Schedule Delivery Modal will open. 
  7. Match these details in the Schedule Delivery modal:

    Settings tab

    Advanced options tab
    • Schedule Name: Uberflip Analytics - Your weekly summary is here!
    • Recurrence: Weekly | Monday | 6:00 (can be adjusted to clients preference)
    • Destination: Email 
    • Email addresses: Enter email and click enter/return. Add as many as you’d like.
    • Format: PNG visualization
    • Custom Message:
    • Custom Message: More metrics available here https://app.uberflip.com/analytics/home?utm_campaign=FY22Q4-CSM-UFA-WeeklyNewsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_source=csm
    • Include links: Must be checked
    • Arrange dashboard tiles in a single column: Must be checked
    • Table resolution: Normal
    • Delivery timezone: Wherever client is located, or client preference
     
  8. Click Save

Content Performance dashboard

The Content Performance Dashboard gives an overview of content health, broken down by Items and content types. The quickly consumable data here can be used to easily see:

  • What content is performing well
  • What content isn’t doing so hot 
  • How content types compare in performance
  • What are the outliers in the content library

This dashboard includes breakdowns of the following:

  • Overall content performance 
  • Item activity (in the last month)
  • Blogpost activity
  • Flipbook activity 
  • Video activity
Content Performance dashboard example (expand to view)

Use standard UFA/Looker processes to add this dashboard to user accounts. The Uberflip Expert Services team can show you how if needed.

Demand Performance dashboard

The Demand Performance dashboard gives an overview of how Hubs and Streams are performing. You’ll also see where traffic is coming from. The quickly consumable data here can be used to easily see:

  • Hub and Stream engagement over the last month
  • Where traffic to Uberflip destinations is coming from 
  • How Stream are performing compared to each other  

This dashboard includes breakdowns of the following:

  • Team stats
  • Stream engagement last month
  • Channel activity last month
  • Form CTA conversions last month
Demand Performance dashboard example (expand to view)

Use standard UFA/Looker processes to add this dashboard to user accounts. The Uberflip Expert Services team can show you how if needed.

item.title: Internal: Offboarding Customer Content from Uberflip
item.description:
Objective

A guide for the CSM through the off-boarding process for a client. This isn't intended to be shared with clients.

 

To-Do List

  1. Provide a Hub Content Export (including item body content in HTML format) to show all URLs
  2. Set up URL redirects for the Hub pages at the server-side and not in the Hub itself, as the Uberflip URLs and redirects will be lost once the Hub is deactivated
  3. For redirects, there are two routes
    • Decouple the domain from your hub and point it to wherever the new destination is (when you are ready to completely migrate off)
    • Use an alternative means of verifying your ownership of the domain (e.g. email). Once Uberflip is deactivated, the content is no longer there, so no redirects can be implemented on our end and must be on the client-side. One option is to send traffic to a page that says, "This content no longer exists here. It has been moved to url.com (or wherever it lives)."
  4. DNS - Be ready to switch your subdomains to the appropriate locations for the new URLs (This has to be done on the CMS/DNS side of things)
  5. If on a subdomain, they can remove the CNAME record in their DNS that is pointing that domain to read.uberflip.com
  6. Download all flipbooks from the account, unless they already have the original versions stored elsewhere, and if they do not have the most updated copies and then upload them where they need to be. You can download the flipbooks by using the hub hack
  7. If they blogged in Uberflip and not on their CMS, and want a backup of that, save the RSS for the Blog Source Stream. There are two options for migrating them:
    • To successfully pull the blog content, go to your content page and click into each individual blog stream and click "RSS". You can then access the feed and if there is a way to ingest RSS feeds in the target location of the content, you can do it that way
    • Copy and paste each one. If you're doing this I'd pick and choose the best performers
  8. If any content from this Hub has been embedded on external web pages, those should be removed
  9. If required, get a JSON Export of Uberflip Analytics and can use it for future reference (this will need to be requested to the Engineering team)
  10. Download all images if they don’t have a file saved.
  11. In your CMS - Add and create any 301s that are required
  12. Export the 301's lists from the Hub.
  13. Have your New URLs/webpages ready to go
  14. Perform a metrics export on their content if they require that

item.title: Internal: Use Bulk Task Smasher to create or update Redirect Rules and Smart Filters
item.description:
Objective

Bulk Task Smasher can be used to perform bulk actions on Redirect Rules and Smart Filters. However, because the Uberflip API has complex requirements for creating or updating these resources, it is very difficult to build the necessary Bulk Task Smasher job template by hand.

To more easily set up job templates to create or update Redirect Rules and Smart Filters with Bulk Task Smasher, follow the process described in this article.

Info

Bulk actions related to Redirect Rules and Smart Filters are available exclusively in the internal version of Bulk Task Smasher, and can only be accessed by Uberflip employees.

Customers who install the public Bulk Task Smasher app do not have access to these actions. As a result, if a customer wants to use the app to perform bulk actions on Redirect Rules and Smart Filters, this must be done by an Uberflip employee on the customer's behalf.

 

Background

As with all Bulk Task Smasher create/update actions, creating or updating Redirect Rules or Smart Filters in bulk requires a valid job template, which is a file containing values that define how the desired Redirect Rules or Smart Filters should work.

However, job templates for Redirect Rules and Smart Filters both require values that must follow very complex syntax rules to be accepted by the Uberflip API. For example, take a Smart Filter with the following search criteria:

  • Located in: Example Hub: Any visible Stream
    AND
  • Item status: Hidden

To create the same search criteria through Bulk Task Smasher, the Uberflip API requires the following value:

{"and_or":{"excludes_streams":"false","excludes_tags":"false","excludes_text":"false","includes_streams":"false","includes_tags":"false","includes_text":"false"},"includes_streams":{"all_non_hidden_streams":"Any visible Stream"},"item_status":{"hidden":"Hidden"}}

Because it would be very difficult and time-consuming to understand and follow these rules to create the necessary values by hand, we recommend an alternate method: create the desired Redirect Rules/Smart Filters in Uberflip, so that you can use them as a model for any additional rules you want to create or update in bulk.

 

Step 1: Create the "model" Redirect Rule(s) or Smart Filter(s)

Before setting up your job template, begin by using Uberflip to create your "model" Redirect Rules and/or Smart Filters. Once created, you will be able to simply copy these into your job templates to create as many Redirect Rules/Smart Filters with the same structure/functionality as needed.

  1. Log in to the Uberflip admin backend and access the Uberflip account you're working with (i.e. the customer account, if you are setting up a bulk action for a customer).
  2. Navigate to the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters section of the platform, depending on the kind of resource you want to create/update in bulk.
  3. Create a new Redirect Rule or Smart Filter and configure it in the same way as the Redirect Rules/Smart Filters you want to create or update in bulk.
    • Repeat this step as needed to create additional template Redirect Rules/Smart Filters.
  4. When you have created the necessary model Redirect Rule(s)/Smart Filter(s), move to the next step.

 

Step 2: Download a Populated Template to get job template values

To get the correct syntax for your Redirect Rules or Smart Filters job template, just download a Populated Template: this will contain the correct values for your "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters, which you can then simply copy to create the job template.

  1. Log in to Bulk Task Smasher using the API credentials of the Uberflip account (customer account) you're working with.
  2. In the Run Jobs section, use the dropddowns to navigate to 
  3. Redirect Rules > Update Redirect Rules or Smart Filters > Update Smart Filters (depending on the type of resource you want to work with).
  4. Click on Download Job Templates, ensure all headers are selected, then click on Download Populated Template.
  5. Open the downloaded job template in Excel (or another spreadsheet program).
  6. In the job template, locate the rows representing the "model" Redirect Rule(s)/Smart Filter(s) you created, then move to the next step.

 

Step 3: Build the job template to create Redirect Rules or Smart Filters

Now that you have the right syntax for a Redirect Rules or Smart Filters job template, you're ready to build it. For both Create and Update bulk actions, you will use the Populated Template you downloaded in the previous step as the base.

For a Create bulk action

If you want to run a Create Redirect Rules or Create Smart Filters bulk action:

  1. In the Populated Template, delete the filter_id column from the spreadsheet.
  2. In the Populated Template, delete all populated rows from the spreadsheet except those representing your "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters.
  3. Copy and paste the "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters rows as many times as necessary to create additional Redirect Rules/Smart Filters with the same structure.
    • You can also copy and paste only cells/columns as needed.
  4. Change any values as required, then run the job template in Bulk Task Smasher to create the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters as specified.

For an Update bulk action

If you want to run an Update Redirect Rules or Update Smart Filters bulk action:

  1. In the Populated Template, delete any rows representing Redirect or Smart Filters that you do NOT want to update from the spreadsheet.
  2. Copy values as needed from the "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters rows and then paste those values into rows representing the Redirect Rules/Smart Filters that you want to update.
  3. Change any other values as required (remember to leave all identifying values, e.g. redirect_id, filter_id, hub_id, etc. unchanged), then run the job template in Bulk Task Smasher to update the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters as specified.

item.title: Internal: Penetration Testing
item.description:
Learn everything you need to know about Penetration testing. This includes what information to request/ how to submit a JIRA ticket for customers interested in running Penetration Testing.

 

Before you begin

  • The processes described in this article are intended for use by Uberflip Support Team.

 

Penetration Testing & What You Need To Know

What is Penetration Testing?

Penetration Testing includes any testing that involves attempting to break in (either virtually or for real) to gain unauthorized access to any Uberflip platform. This does not include vulnerability scanning where data is collected to identify potential or known vulnerabilities, but makes no attempt to exploit them. All Penetration Tests must follow the Uberflip Penetration Testing Rules of Engagement.

 

What are the 'Rules of Engagement'?

Before any testing can commence, customers must request written permission to perform the Penetration Testing. Requests can be made by email to support@uberflip.com. Uberflip Support will then need to submit a JIRA ticket and send an email with required details to security@uberflip.com. (These steps are outlined below).

Along with the request from the customer, the customer will need to provide Uberflip Support with the following information:

- IP ranges the tests will be originating from

- Dates and times of the testing

- Point of contact

For customers of Uberflip, the Penetration Testing results are subject to their confidentiality obligations in the agreement between customer and Uberflip. If they are not currently a customer, they will need to enter into a NDA with Uberflip prior to conducting the penetration testing.

 

What happens if the customer doesn't follow the proper procedure?

All Penetration Tests must follow the Uberflip Penetration Testing Rules of Engagement. The use of the Uberflip platform will continue to be subject to the terms and conditions of the agreement(s) under which the customer purchased the relevant service. Any violation of these Rules of Engagement or the relevant service terms may result in suspension or termination of the customers account and legal action as set forth in the Uberflip Service Terms. The customer is responsible for any damage to Uberflip platforms or other customers data that is caused by any failure to abide by these Rules of Engagement or the Uberflip Service Terms.

 

Is there any type of Penetration testing that is prohibited?

The following activities are prohibited:

- Scanning or testing assets belonging to any other Uberflip customers.

- Gaining access to any data that is not wholly your own.

- Performing any kind of denial of service testing.

- Performing network intensive fuzzing.

- Performing automated testing of services that generates significant amounts of traffic.

- Deliberately accessing any other customer’s data.

- Moving beyond “proof of concept” steps (i.e. proving that you have system access is acceptable, running further scripts or commands to copy, delete, or modify data is not).

- Using our services in a way that violates the Acceptable Use Policy.

- Attempting phishing or other social engineering attacks against our employees.

- Using any Uberflip asset to launch attacks against third parties.

Even with these prohibitions, Uberflip reserves the right to respond to any actions on its networks that appear to be malicious. Uberflip uses a number of security mechanisms to protect our platforms. These will not be disabled to facilitate a penetration test. Depending on the severity of the impact, the response may include anything from Uberflip contacting the account owner, to blocking all traffic from the originating IP, to disabling the customer’s account entirely.

 

Process: Requesting Penetration Testing

Use this process to request penetration testing.

1. Customer must request written permission to perform Penetration Testing to support@uberflip.com. Along with request the customer must include the following in their email to Support (these are the details outlined in the Rules of Engagement)

- IP ranges the tests will be originating from

- Dates and times of the testing

- Point of contact

2. Internally submit a JIRA ticket to our Development team outlining the customers request and the 3 requirements from the Rules of Engagement. The Development will take approximately 5 business days to get back to you with either acceptance, declining or requiring more details from the original request.

3. Internally send an email to security@uberflip.com including the same details as the JIRA ticket. 

4. Share the information with the customer.

item.title: Internal: Integrating Bizible with Uberflip Form CTAs
item.description:
TV1 Hubs Installation

The following are instructions for installing Bizible on a TV1 Hub

Step 1: Add Bizible CDN script in a code block

Details

  • Type: Javascript
  • Placement: Head

Code

<script type="text/javascript" src="//cdn.bizible.com/scripts/bizible.js"
  async=""></script>

Step 2: Add additional block of Javascript in a code block

Details

  • Type: Javascript
  • Placement: Body Bottom

Code

<script>
Hubs.Events.on('load', function() {
    window['Bizible'] = window['Bizible'] || { _queue: [], Push: function (o, p) {this._queue.push({ type: o, data: p }); } };
});

Hubs.Events.on('ctaFormSubmitSuccess', function(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName) {
    bizibleFormCode(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName);
});


function bizibleFormCode(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName) {
    var email = ctaData["email"];
    if (email) {
        Bizible.Push('User', {
            eMail: email, // required
        });
    }
}
</script>

TV2 Hubs Installation

The following are instructions for installing Bizible on a TV2 Hub

Step 1: Add Bizible CDN script in a code block

Details

  • Type: Javascript
  • Placement: Head

Code

<script type="text/javascript" src="//cdn.bizible.com/scripts/bizible.js"
  async=""></script>

Step 2: Add additional block of Javascript in a code block

Details

  • Type: Javascript
  • Placement: Body Bottom

Code

<script>
window.addEventListener('uberflip.load', () => {
    window['Bizible'] = window['Bizible'] || { _queue: [], Push: function (o, p) {this._queue.push({ type: o, data: p }); } };
});

window.addEventListener('uberflip.ctaFormSubmitSuccess', (ctaId, ctaData, ctaName) => {
    bizibleFormCode(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName);
});


function bizibleFormCode(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName) {
    var email = $('input[type=email]').val();
    if(email){
        Bizible.Push('User', {
        eMail: email, // required
    }); 
    }
}
</script>

item.title: Theme a Hub using the Theme Selector app
item.description:
Use the Theme Selector app to quickly and easily change the look and feel of your Hub by applying premade themes.

Warning: Internal use only

Theme Selector is for internal use only.

  • During the initial soft launch/beta period, the app should only be used by internal users (primarily CSMs and Implementation Specialists) on behalf of customers. 
  • In anticipation of a potential public release, this article was written with an external (customer) audience in mind. However, this article is NOT intended to be shared externally at this time. Note also that certain details in this article (including the name of the app) may differ from what you see in the beta version of the app.
  • UPDATE (Feb. 14, 2022): This app has been renamed to PLT-0 Poch, in line with the codenames used for Project LEGO apps during the internal release phase.

For more information, please contact Zayyan Chowdhury or Chris Johnson.

Before you begin

  • Before you can use the Theme Selector app, you need to install it from the Uberflip Marketplace (click on Marketplace in the top navigation in Uberflip).
  • To use this app, your Hub must be running Front End V2. The app is not compatible with Front End V1 Hubs. If you're not sure which version of the Uberflip Hub Front End your Hub is using, see this article.
  • To configure the app, it is helpful (but not required) to have some knowledge of basic HTML tags, CSS properties, and related concepts (e.g. HTML color codes).
  • This app is intended to be used with pre-launch Hubs (i.e. Hubs that are still in the implementation stage, and are not yet live on the web). Because it immediately changes the appearance and behavior of your Hub, using this app with live/production Hubs is not recommended.

 

About the Theme Selector app

Out of the box, the design of an Uberflip Hub is clean and responsive — but also quite basic. That's intentional, because we know that most of our customers like to extensively customize the design of their Hubs to meet brand guidelines, match existing websites, or just to achieve a particular look and feel.

If you have the time and development budget, you can use custom code to make your Hub look pretty much however you want. But this can be time-consuming and expensive, and sometimes you just need to get a Hub up and running fast — and while you want it to look good, you're not looking for an elaborate and hyper-customized design.

If that sounds like you, the Theme Selector app is exactly what you're looking for. With Theme Selector, you can apply themes to your Hub: ready-made designs that completely change your Hub's look and feel in seconds, all without needing to write a single line of code.

How does it work?

Theme Selector themes are premade customizations for Uberflip Hubs. Think of them as the off-the-shelf equivalent of a fully-custom Hub front end: you don't get to customize every aspect, but you do get a great-looking, professionally designed Hub in a fraction of the time.

Theme Selector themes work essentially the same way as themes you might have used on other web platforms, such as WordPress Themes: just pick a theme and apply it, and your Hub is instantly transformed.

For example, you can make your Hub go from this:

To this:

All in seconds, and with just a few clicks.

With all themes, you can set the colors of specific elements and import custom fonts, and some even have advanced features and functionality that can be customized to your preferences. And because all themes are loaded into your Hub from a centralized repository, there are no manual downloads or ZIP files to deal with.

Where can I find themes?

Theme Selector is currently in beta, so both the app itself and the themes are still under development. This means that there may be some bugs, and that certain features of the app still require advanced configuration (i.e. editing custom code snippets).

As a result, you'll need to work with your Customer Success Manager or Implementation Specialist to get access to and install themes at this time. To get started, please get in touch with your CSM or IS.

 

Setup

Before you can begin using Theme Selector, you need to ensure the Compatibility Pack app is installed in your Uberflip account. This app is required to make most apps work correctly with Front End V2, the technology that powers current Uberflip Hubs.

To install the Compatibility Pack app, simply go to the Marketplace in Uberflip, then search for "Compatibility Pack" and click Install.

 

Apply a theme

Info

You configure this app at the Hub level, which means that your settings will apply only to the Hub you are currently working in. If you have multiple Hubs, you must configure (and use) this app separately in each Hub.

Once you have installed Theme Selector in your Uberflip account and have selected a theme, you can apply the theme to any Hub within your account.

To apply a theme, you will need:

  • Its theme code, which uniquely identifies the theme. Your Uberflip CSM or IS will provide you with the theme code for your selected theme.
  • The theme documentation, which describes how the theme works and how to configure theme-specific functionality and settings. It generally also tells you which front end elements are affected by Theme Selector's color settings, and in some cases provides a custom code snippet that you will need to install on your Hub(s) to allow the theme to work properly.

Make sure to read the theme documentation for your selected theme carefully before proceeding. When you're ready to apply the theme to your Hub, follow the instructions below:

  1. Log in to your Uberflip account as an Account Administrator or Content Manager.
  2. Navigate to the Hub where you want to apply the theme.
  3. If your chosen theme requires a custom code snippet (see the theme documentation for your theme), add it to your Hub now before going any further.
    • See this article for instructions on how to add custom code to your Hub.
  4. In the Uberflip sidebar menu, click on Integrations, then click on Installed Apps:
  5. In the list of apps on the right, find Theme Selector and hover your mouse over it. Click on the Edit (pencil) button that appears on the right:

  6. This will open the settings menu for Theme Selector. To apply your chosen theme, simply type its theme code into the field under Selected theme:
  7. The selected theme will be applied immediately with default colors and settings. To see the results in your Hub, click on the Open Hub button at the top of the sidebar menu:

Configure a theme

Once you have applied a theme, you can customize specific colors and fonts using the app settings under Integrations > Installed Apps > Theme Selector > Edit.

  • Theme Selector's color and font settings are common to all themes, but the specific elements they control will vary depending on the selected theme. For specific details, refer to the theme documentation for the theme you are using.
  • All color settings will accept values in any standard HTML color format, i.e. HTML/CSS color names (basic and extended), HEX, RGB/RGBA, or HSL/HSLA.
  • When entering any value into settings do not enter a ; (semicolon) after the value, as this will cause CSS problems and the specified color will not be applied. For example:
    • Yes: #CE0058
    • No: #CE0058;
  • All of these settings are optional: if you do not specify anything for a given setting, Theme Selector will simply use the theme default for that setting.

Note

If your selected theme requires a custom code snippet, you can often also customize the snippet to configure advanced functionality available in the theme. Details on how to do so can be found in the theme documentation.

You can find details about the available settings and how to configure them below:

Primary color

Sets the theme's primary color, typically used throughout the theme for prominent visual elements (though this can vary by theme). In most cases, you would set this to your main brand color.

Secondary color

Sets the theme's secondary color, typically used throughout the theme as an accent color (though this can vary by theme). In most cases, you would set this to a secondary brand color or other complementary color.

Headline color

Sets the color of all headings across all pages in your Hub, i.e. any text within heading tags (<h1> to <h6>). This includes page titles, Item tile titles (but not CTA tile taglines), Item Page subheadings, and so on.

Text color

Sets the color of all body text across all pages in your Hub, i.e. any text within paragraph tags (<p>). This includes most non-heading text such as Item page body text and CTA tile taglines, but does not include links (text within <a> tags), including the text links in the Hub menu.

Hover text color

Sets the color of all text in themes that feature a hover effect in which the background color changes.

Most commonly used for Item tiles that have a slide-up-on-hover effect which displays a preview of the content: typically, the Primary color setting will be used for the background color, so this should be set to a color that contrasts well against that color to be readable.

Tile border color

Sets the color of the border of Item and CTA tiles, in themes that use a border. Does not have any effect in themes that do not use tile borders.

Body color

Sets the background color of the document body (everything within the <body> tags) across all pages in your Hub. Note that this does not include the hub menu, header, footer, and any visible tiles, or the article container on Item pages.

.

Hub menu background color

Sets the background color of the Hub menu that's displayed at the top of all pages in your Hub (except in Sales Streams).

Menu text color

Sets the color of the text in the Hub menu (i.e. the menu items).

Tile action text color

Sets the color of the action text on Item tiles, i.e. "Read Article", "Watch Video", etc. Note that this is the "static state" color, and that many themes also apply a "hover state" color for this text on mouse hover (which is typically controlled by another setting depending on theme, such as Primary color, Secondary color or Item link text color).

Item link text color

Sets the color of text links on Item pages only (i.e. text within <a> tags in your content).

Button color

Sets the background color of the various buttons across your Hub, such as the "Return Home" button on Item pages (if used in the current theme).

Primary font link

Sets the custom font used for headings (<h1> to <h6>) on all pages across your Hub. Custom fonts must be hosted (e.g. on a service like Google Fonts) and importable from a URL.

To set a custom font, enter the font's embed link into the field in this format:

<link href="[embed URL goes here]" rel="stylesheet">

For example, for a Google Fonts font, click on +Select this style, choose <link> in the sidebar under Use on the web, and copy and paste this part (you can also include the <link rel="preconnect"... portion if it fits):

Note

There is a character limit of 255 characters on this field, so adding a lot of styles (variants of the same font) can make the embed link exceed this character limit. To avoid this, try to limit the included styles to just those you need.

Primary font family

Set the font-family CSS property (i.e. the font name) for the selected Primary font, along with any fallback fonts in case the Primary font is not available.

To set the font family, enter it into the field in this format. Start with the imported custom font, then any fallback fonts. Do not include font-family: at the beginning, or ; at the end:

'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif

For a Google Fonts font, simply copy and paste this part under CSS rules to specify families (remember to exclude font-family: at the beginning and ; at the end):

Secondary font link

Sets the custom font used for all non-heading text, including links (i.e. text within <p> and <a> tags) on all pages across your Hub. This setting is configured the same way as the Primary font link setting.

Secondary font family

Set the font-family CSS property (i.e. the font name) for the selected Secondary font, along with any fallback fonts in case the Secondary font is not available. This setting is configured the same way as the Primary font family setting.

 

Next steps

Want to further customize your new theme? You can build your own customizations on top of a theme with custom code, or talk to your Customer Success Manager or Implementation Specialist about working with Uberflip's onBrand front end development team.

Also, don't forget about Uberflip's built-in branding and customization settings (for setting banners, logos, favicons, etc.), as well as Marketing and Sales Stream template appearance settings, as they are (generally) compatible with themes!

item.title: Internal: Common Reverse Proxy Configurations
item.description:
1. Amazon CloudFront CDN

 Create a new Origin for read.uberflip.com

Create a Behaviour for the path will be used for the Hub on the subdirectory (E.g. /resources-test). The path will point to the Origin setup for read.uberflip.com

Edit the Behaviour to align the settings like the ones shown below:

item.title: Internal: Delete Uberflip Analytics Data for a Customer
item.description:
About Deleting UFA Data

Customers may ask us to delete data collected by Uberflip Analytics. There are two main scenarios in which a customer might make this request:

  • They have received a "right to be forgotten request" (GDPR) from a person who has visited one or more of their Hubs, and must delete that user's data from Uberflip Analytics
  • They want to delete all data collected by Uberflip Analytics for all Hubs under their account

Uberflip Analytics (UFA) has Data Controls which are designed to service these requests. There are two functions:

  • Delete Visitor Data: Deletes any UFA visitor data related to a specific unique identifier (UUID) that was assigned to a visitor's browser
  • Delete All Data: Delete all UFA data associated with a particular Uberflip account (including all Hubs belonging to the account)

Both options are permanent: any UFA data deleted using Data Controls is not recoverable.

The current implementation of Data Controls is not ready for end users, and is only accessible through a direct URL that is intended to be used by Uberflip Support. As a result, Uberflip Support must assist customers with requests to delete UFA data at this time.

 

Access UFA Data Controls

To delete UFA data for a customer, use UFA Data Controls. You must access Data Controls from the Uberflip app while logged into a customer's account, but it is not possible to navigate there using the app menus. Instead, you must use the direct URL for the Data Controls page to access it.

Warning

The current version of Data Controls is not intended for use by customers. As a result, please do not share the direct URL to the Data Controls page with any customer.

  1. Using the Admin backend, log in to the customer's account.
  2. Once you are logged in, use the following URL to open the Data Controls page:
    https://app.uberflip.com/analytics/data_controls
  3. The Data Controls page for the customer's account should load, where you can delete data from UFA either for just a specific visitor, or across the whole account.

 

Delete a Visitor's UFA Data from a Customer Account

Under certain privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR), visitors to a website can request that the website operator delete any personal data that has been collected about them, including data collected by web analytics tools like UFA.

In general, a visitor who wants their website data to be deleted would send this request to the Uberflip customer who owns the relevant Hub(s). Because the customer is not able to delete UFA data themselves, they would need to pass the request on to Uberflip — either by working with Uberflip Support on behalf of the visitor, or by asking the visitor to contact Uberflip Support directly.

Important

The visitor and the customer are not the same person. For the purposes of the instructions below, the labels "visitor" and "customer" have the following definitions:

  • Visitor: The third-party individual who has visited a customer's Hub(s), and is asking for their data to be deleted.
  • Customer: The Uberflip customer who owns the Hub that the visitor viewed.

For simplicity, the instructions assume you are speaking with the visitor directly. If you are communicating with the customer, keep in mind that steps directed at the visitor can not be completed by the customer on the visitor's behalf. Instead, you would need to ask the customer to instruct the visitor to complete them.

Step 1: Get The Visitor's UUID

To delete the data associated with a specific individual visitor, Uberflip requires that visitor's UUID (universally unique identifier).

UFA assigns a UUID to each browser that loads an Uberflip Hub, and all data that UFA collects about a browser is tagged with its UUID. Therefore, we use the UUID to identify and delete all data relating to a particular browser (i.e. visitor) within the UFA database.

Note

UFA assigns UUIDs at the account level. This means that a browser will have the same UUID across all Hubs that belong to the same Uberflip account. If a browser enters two Hubs that belong to two separate Uberflip accounts, it will be assigned two separate UUIDs (one per account).

UFA also assigns UUIDs per browser, so every separate browser (including mobile browsers) that a visitor uses to view an Uberflip Hub will receive its own UUID. As a result, a visitor may have multiple UUIDs within a given customer's account.

When a visitor asks for their UFA data to be deleted, Uberflip has no way of determining what that visitor's UUID is: UFA data is identified only with a UUID, and is not linked to other personal information (e.g. name, email, etc.) that could be used to associate the UUID with a specific individual. As a result, the visitor must provide their UUID to Uberflip in order for us to complete their request.

There are two ways that a visitor can provide their UUID to Uberflip:

Direct Method: Find UUID With DevTools Indirect Method: Infer UUID With Dedicated Item

The visitor can extract their own UUID from their browser data using DevTools and provide it to Uberflip.

  • Pro: Requires no setup or action by Uberflip Support or the customer — the visitor simply provides the UUID.
  • Con: The process to find the UUID may be intimidating and difficult to complete for a non-technical visitor.

To use:

  1. Notify the visitor that we will need their UUID to identify and delete their UFA data.
  2. Instruct the visitor on how to find their UUID using DevTools. The following article describes the process, and can also be provided to the visitor directly: Find Your Uberflip Analytics Identifier (UUID).
  3. After the visitor has provided their UUID, you can proceed with deleting their UFA data.

The visitor can view view a purpose-built Item that is shared only with them. This allows Uberflip to infer their UUID by subsequently viewing analytics for the Item in UFA: because nobody else viewed the Item, there should only be one pageview recorded, and the UUID associated with this pageview must belong to the visitor in question. 

  • Pro: Very low difficulty for the average visitor — requires minimal action and no technical knowledge on their part.
  • Con: Requires setup and action by Uberflip or the customer. Visitors who want their UFA data to be deleted may be unwilling to visit another Uberflip page, and it may be challenging to explain why this action is necessary.

To use:

  1. Create a hidden/no-index Item in the customer's Hub.
    • Can be in any Hub belonging to the same account that the visitor wants their data deleted from.
    • Make a note of the Item ID, as you will need it for a later step.
    • The Item does not need any content, but it may be helpful to provide some minimal explanatory text, or something like "Thank you, you should receive a response to your request shortly", etc.
  2. Notify the visitor that they need to visit a special page so that Uberflip can identify and delete their UFA data. Share the URL to the Item you created in Step 1, and ask the visitor to respond with the date/time they visited (to confirm that they visited, and as a point of reference).
  3. After the visitor responds, open UFA for the Hub that contains the special Item.
  4. Navigate to the Single Item Performance dashboard by drilling into any Item (as described here).
  5. After you have opened the Single Item Performance dashboard, switch to the special Item by entering its Item ID into the Item ID filter at the top:
  6. When the special Item has loaded in the dashboard, scroll down to the Visitor Sessions table.
  7. In the Item View column of this table, use the date and time of the visit provided by the visitor to determine which line in the table represents their visit (there may only be one line):
  8. On this line, look under the Visitor column. Here, click on the ... button next to the Visitor ID, then click on Single Visitor History:
  9. The Single Visitor History dashboard for the selected visitor will appear. In the top left, look in the Visitor Details table to find the Visitor UUID:
  10. When you have the UUID, you can proceed with deleting this visitor's UFA data.

Step 2: Delete Visitor's UFA Data

After you have obtained a visitor's UUID, you can use it to delete their UFA data using Data Controls. You must do this in the account of the customer who owns the Hub(s) from which UFA data should be deleted.

This process will delete the visitor's UFA data for all Hubs associated with the customer's account, so you only need to do it once for each UUID, even if the visitor viewed multiple Hubs owned by the customer.

  1. Log in to the customer's account and open the UFA Data Controls page.
  2. On the Data Controls page, find Delete Visitor Analytics.
  3. In the text field below Delete Visitor Analytics, enter the UUID of the visitor who has asked for their UFA data to be deleted (which you obtained earlier).
  4. Click on Delete Data beside the text field.
  5. A confirmation window will appear. Click on Delete Data in this window to confirm the deletion.
  6. You'll be returned to the Data Controls screen, and a Deletion Process Started notification will appear in the lower right corner.
  7. Notify the visitor (directly or via the customer) that the visitor's data has been deleted, and that the process may take up to 4 hours to complete.

 

Delete All UFA Data From a Customer's Account

In some cases, customers may ask for Uberflip to delete all data that UFA has collected in relation to their account (and all Hubs within it). The most likely scenario for such a request is in the context of a customer closing their account, but it may also happen in other situations (e.g. just before launching their first Hub, to "clear out" UFA data that was generated during implementation).

Warning

This process will permanently delete ALL UFA data associated with a customer's account. It applies across all Hubs, and can not be performed for only a specific Hub. Deleted data can not be recovered. This process should only be used if the customer will never need this data again.

Before proceeding, ensure that the customer fully understands the consequences of this action, and that deleting UFA data can not be undone.

  1. Log in to the customer's account and open the UFA Data Controls page.
  2. On the Data Controls page, find Delete All Analytics.
  3. Click on the Delete Data button that is shown below this heading.
  4. A confirmation window will appear. Click on Delete Data in this window to confirm the deletion.
  5. You'll be returned to the Data Controls screen, and a Deletion Process Started notification will appear in the lower right corner.
  6. Notify the customer that all UFA data associated with their account has been deleted, and that the process may take up to 4 hours to complete.

item.title: Internal: Enable Let's Encrypt SSL (TLS) Certificates for Customer Domains
item.description:
Objective

Enable a Let's Encrypt SSL Certificate for a customer who wants to use the Uberflip-managed certificate option for their Hub's domain.

This process applies to customers who created their domain before May 22, 2020 and either:

  • Did not use HTTPS with that domain, but want to now
  • Used HTTPS with the domain with an Uberflip-managed certificate (Digicert)
  • Used HTTPS with the domain with a self-managed certificate

Domains created after May 22, 2020 (or domains created earlier than this date by customers who were part of the HTTPS For All beta program) will automatically have a Let's Encrypt certificate enabled, so this process would not apply.

 

Enable a Let's Encrypt Certificate for a Domain

  1. In the Uberflip admin backend, click on Domains.
  2. Search for the domain that the customer has asked to have SSL (TLS) activated on.
  3. When you have located the domain, click on the Allow LE Cert button for this domain (on the right side):

    ​
  4. This will begin processing the Let's Encrypt certificate for the selected domain. Processing will be completed overnight, and the domain will be secured by the following morning.

 

If Needed: Remove Existing Certificate

If a domain is using a customer-managed certificate, you can still enable a Let's Encrypt certificate for that domain, but it can't be activated until the customer's certificate has been removed.

Removal of an existing customer-managed certificate must be done by OPS. If the domain has an existing customer-managed certificate, submit a new OPS ticket in Jira to request that it be removed. As soon as OPS removes the self-managed certificate, the previously enabled Let's Encrypt certificate will take effect immediately.

item.title: Internal: Access Primary User-Restricted Settings on a Customer Account
item.description:
Objective

Certain menus in the Account Settings area of the Uberflip app are visible only to the account's Primary User (e.g. the Security menus). For all other Account Administrators in the same account, these menus are hidden and therefore inaccessible.

When logging in to a customer's account from the Uberflip Admin Backend (e.g. as a Support user), you are given the same privileges as an Account Administrator user in that account. By default, you will therefore not be able to see the menus that only the Primary User has access to. If you need to access these menus for troubleshooting purposes, use the following workaround.

 

Access "Hidden" Primary User Menus in a Customer Account

  1. Open an incognito browser window and log in to a Hub where you are the Primary User.
  2. In the Hub where you are the Primary User, navigate to the menu that you need to access in the customer's Hub.
  3. Copy the URL from the address bar.
  4. In a different browser window (does not need to be incognito), log in to the customer's account via the Uberflip Admin Backend.
  5. In the same browser window, paste the URL you copied from the incognito browser window.
  6. The previously inaccessible menu should now load in the customer's account.

item.title: Resend an Email Invitation to a New User
item.description:
Objective

Resend an invitation email to add a new user to your Uberflip account (e.g. if the user never received or lost the original email).

 

Send an New Invitation Email

  1. Log out of your Uberflip account (if you are currently logged in):
     
  2. Visit the following link: https://app.uberflip.com/users/forgot_password.
  3. In the Email field, enter the email address of the user to whom you want to resend the email invitation.
  4. Click the Request Password Reset button.
  5. The specified user will be sent an email with a link to reset their password. When they click on this link, they will be able to create a password for the account associated with their email address, then log in with these credentials.

 

Additional Notes

In order for this to be successful, the user must have already been created (with the same email address you entered) in your Uberflip account.

The password reset email can take a few minutes to be delivered to the user after you request it. As with all automated emails, it may be misidentified as spam, so the user should check their spam folder as well.

item.title: Internal: Hub Hack: Divide a Marketing Stream Into Sections [REFERENCE ONLY]
item.description:
Learn how to divide a Marketing Stream into distinct sections with their own headings with this Hub Hack.

Important

This article has been retired and is provided for reference only.

This article describes a method that is no longer in use. It is provided here for reference only. Do not use the method described in this article in a customer Hub. If you have questions, please contact the OnBrand team.

Before You Begin

  • To follow the instructions in this article, you will need to use the Custom Code feature. To use this feature, you need to be an Account Admin or Content Manager.
  • You should also be comfortable with using the Custom Code feature and working with custom code in your Hub. While not required, a basic familiarity with HTML, CSS and JavaScript is helpful for following this guide.
  • This Hub Hack can only create sections in Marketing Streams. It does not work with Sales Streams or any type of Source Stream.
  • For the purposes of this guide, we will assume that the Marketing Stream you want to add sections to already exists. If not, please create the Stream and add content to it before proceeding.

 

About Stream Sections

What This Hub Hack Does

In certain Streams, it can sometimes make sense to divide the content into sections to make it easier for visitors to navigate.

For example, in the Uberflip Academy, we have a number of training videos that cover various aspects of setting up your Uberflip Hub. The videos are all within a single Stream so that they're easy to browse, but they're also logically organized around the stages of the Content Experience Framework: some videos relate to centralizing content, others to personalizing experiences, and so on.

We wanted to make it clear which videos related to each stage, so we split the Stream into sections that correspond to these stages, as you can see below:

If you have a similar use case in your Hub, you can use the Hub Hack described in this article to create your own sectioned Streams.

How It Works

As with all Hub Hacks, Stream sections are primarily driven by custom code snippets that you'll add to your Hub. But because Uberflip doesn't have a built-in way to create "dividers" between content Items, you'll also need to do some additional setup work to achieve this effect. Specifically, you'll need to create:

  • Link CTAs for every section heading you need
  • A special placeholder Item in a dedicated Stream

Here's how it works:

To create the section headings in the Stream, you will use specially-formatted Link CTAs. Each section heading will be represented by a single Link CTA, and the Tagline/Copy text that you set on the CTA will be used as the section heading text that is displayed within the Stream. For example, this Link CTA:

Will look like this when used as a section heading in a Stream:

Once created, you can simply put these Link CTAs anywhere within the Stream that you want to place a section heading.

Important

Because this Hub Hack uses Link CTAs to create section headings, it's subject to a Link CTA-related limitation: all Link CTAs must be placed within the first 20 Items in a Stream.

This means that, although you can use this Hub Hack on Streams with any number of Items, your last section heading must appear before the 20th Item in the Stream (or earlier). In other words, you will not be able to place any section headings after the 20th Item.

You will also need to create a placeholder Item in a dedicated Stream. This placeholder Item is needed as a workaround for a placement problem: the Link CTA that represents the first section heading needs to be placed before the first content Item, but a CTA can't be in first position in a Stream. To get around this, you use the placeholder Item to occupy first position in the Stream, with the first section heading CTA in second position, like this:

Because the placeholder Item will be hidden with custom code, the CTA in second position will effectively be in first position when the Stream is viewed — putting the first section heading at the top of the page, with no Items above it.

The placeholder Item also serves a second purpose by functioning as the "on switch" for this Hub Hack. When you add the placeholder Item to any Marketing Stream, the custom code will look for the specially-formatted Link CTAs within that Stream, and will display them as section headings if they're present. This makes it easy to create additional sectioned Streams later.

 When you're ready to get started, follow the steps below.

 

Step 1: Create a Placeholder Item in a Dedicated Stream

To get started, create a new Blog Stream, then create the placeholder Item inside this Stream. The placeholder Item will be hidden by custom code, and you will use it to enable sections on any Marketing Stream of your choice by simply adding it to the Stream. For details on why this placeholder Item is needed, see above.

For this guide, we will assume you are familiar with Blog Streams and Items, and will not provide step-by-step guidance on how to create a Stream or Item. For detailed instructions, see this article.

Important

You must create a new Stream, and this Stream should contain ONLY the placeholder Item. There are a few reasons for this:

  • It's cleaner: having the placeholder Item in a dedicated Stream makes it easier for others to understand and modify this setup later
  • The Stream itself must be hidden and must not be indexable, so it can't be used for anything else
  • The custom code snippet that powers this Hub Hack hides all content from this Stream, so any other Items you add to it will be invisible everywhere
  1.  Log in to your Uberflip account and navigate to the Hub with the Stream to which you want to add sections.
  2. To begin, create a new Blog Stream.
    • Make sure you choose the "Start from scratch" option when creating the Stream.
    • We recommend calling this Stream something that clearly indicates its purpose, such as "Stream Sections Placeholder Stream", and briefly describing this purpose in the Stream description.
  3. Once the new Stream has been created, open it. Configure it as follows:
    • Hide the Stream (three-dot "meatball" menu in top right > Hide).
    • Turn on No Robots Meta Tag (Options tab > No Robots Meta Tag).
  4. Go to the Stream's Items tab and create a new Item.
    • Again, we recommend using an article title that clearly describes its purpose, such a "Hidden Placeholder Item for Stream Sections".
    • We recommend pasting the following text snippet into the body of the article: 
      Do NOT delete this article or remove it from this Stream!

      If you are viewing this article in a Marketing Stream, do NOT change its position in the Stream.

      This article is used to create sections in Streams. For more information, see here:
      https://help.uberflip.com/hc/en-us/articles/360037349611
    • Do NOT use the "Hide" setting (Metadata tab > Status) for this article (ensure it is set to "Show"), as the article will be hidden using custom code in the next step.
  5. While still viewing the new article in the article editor, look at the address bar in your browser. The URL should end with three groups of digits separated by forward slashes (/), like this:
  6. Make a note of this article's Item ID, which is the middle group of digits (without the slashes):
  7. Also make a note of this Stream's Stream ID, which is the last group of digits (without slashes):
  8. Finally, publish the new article.
    • Even though it will never be shown anywhere, the article must be published for this Hub Hack to work.

After publishing the new article, move on to the next step.

 

Step 2: Add Custom Code

The next step is to add the custom code blocks that power this hack to your Hub. You will create two separate code blocks: one for CSS, and one for JavaScript. To complete this step, you will need the Stream ID and the Item ID you noted down in the previous step.

For this guide, we will assume you are familiar with custom code blocks, and will not provide step-by-step guidance on how to create and enable them. For detailed instructions, see this article.

CSS Custom Code Block

Configuration

Name: Stream Sections (CSS) (or any name you prefer)

Description: CSS to enable Stream Sections, as documented here: https://help.uberflip.com/hc/en-us/articles/360037349611 (or any description you prefer)

Privacy Group: None

Placement: Head

Code

CSS Code Snippet
<style>
/*Make items from the sectioning placeholder streams invisible everywhere*/
[data-source-stream-id = "INSERT STREAM ID"] {
 display: none;
}

/*Enable sections using CTAs in Streams containing the specified Item*/
#collection-items {
 opacity: 0;
 transition: opacity 0.3s ease;
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .description-block {
 margin-bottom: 0;
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .tile[data-id="INSERT ITEM ID"] {
 display: none !important;
}
body.single-page .tile[data-id="INSERT ITEM ID"] {
 display: none!important;
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title {
 font-weight: 300;
 font-size: 25px;
 line-height: 29px;
 margin-bottom: 20px;
 display: block;
 clear: both;
 background: transparent;
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title a {
 display: block;
 position: relative;
 top: -120px;
 visibility: hidden;
}
@media screen and (max-width: 860px) {
 body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title a {
 top: -90px; 
 }
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title p {
 padding-top: 30px;
 padding-bottom: 10px;
 margin-bottom: 32px;
 position: relative;
 display: block;
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title p:after {
 content: "";
 position: absolute;
 bottom: 0;
 left: 0;
 height: 1px;
 width: calc(100% - 20px);
 background-color: #ddd;
}
@media screen and (max-width: 560px) {
 body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title p:after {
 width: 100%;
 }
}
body.custom-cta-segmentation .uf-section-title:first-child p {
 padding-top: 0;
}
</style>

Paste the code snippet provided above into the code box. Make the following changes:

  • Search for [data-source-stream-id = "INSERT STREAM ID"] and replace INSERT STREAM ID with the Stream ID you made a note of in the previous step (make sure to keep the quotes).
  • Search for [data-id = "INSERT ITEM ID"] and replace INSERT ITEM ID with the Item ID you made a note of in the previous step (make sure to keep the quotes).

After pasting in the code snippet, save, then enable the code block.

JavaScript Custom Code Block

Configuration

Name: Stream Sections (JS) (or any name you prefer)

Description: JavaScript to enable Stream Sections, as documented here: https://help.uberflip.com/hc/en-us/articles/360037349611 (or any description you prefer)

Privacy Group: None

Placement: Body Bottom

Code

JavaScript Code Snippet
<script>
window.ctaSegmentationLoaded = false;

$('.single-page .item-prev a[data-item-id="INSERT ITEM ID"]').parent().hide();

var ctaSegmentation = function() {
 var spacerTile = $('.tile[data-tags="spacer-tile"]');

if (spacerTile.length > 0) {
 // spacerTile.remove();
 spacerTile.hide();
 }
 
 if (!$("body").hasClass("single-page")) {
 $("a.cta-button").each(function(index, el) {
 var currentButton = $(el);
 if (currentButton.text() === "section") {
 $("body").addClass("custom-cta-segmentation");
 var sectionTitle = currentButton.siblings("p").text();
 var link = currentButton.attr('href').replace(/(^\w+:|^)\/\//, '');
 link = link.split('.')[0];
 currentButton
 .parent()
 .removeClass()
 .addClass("uf-section-title")
 .removeAttr("style")
 .html(
 '<a id=' + link + '>' + '</a>' + '<p>' + sectionTitle + '</p>'
 );
 }
 });
 $("#collection-items").css('opacity', '1');
 } else {
 var itemPrev = $(".item-prev");
 if (itemPrev.find("span.title").text() === "spacer") {
 itemPrev.html("");
 }
 }
 
};

Hubs.Events.on('load', function(){
 if(!window.ctaSegmentationLoaded){
 ctaSegmentation();
 window.ctaSegmentationLoaded = true;
 }

});
if(!window.ctaSegmentationLoaded){
 Hubs.Events.trigger('load');
}
</script>

Paste the code snippet provided above into the code box. Make the following change:

  • Search for [data-item-id = "INSERT ITEM ID"] and replace INSERT ITEM ID with the Item ID you made a note of in the previous step (make sure to keep the quotes).

After pasting in the code snippet, save, then enable the code block.

After creating and enabling both custom code blocks, move on to the next step.

 

Step 3: Create Section Heading Link CTAs

Next, create the Link CTAs that will serve as the section headings in your Stream. You'll need to create one Link CTA for every section heading you want to use.

For this guide, we will assume you are familiar with Link CTAs and will not provide step-by-step guidance on how to create them. For detailed instructions, see this article.

Configure each Link CTA as follows:

  • For the CTA name, choose any name you want (it will not be displayed in the Stream, only in the CTA Manager). We suggest indicating the Stream that this CTA will be used in in the name field.
  • Layout tab > Tagline/Copy: Type the heading text you want to use.
    • This is the text that will actually be displayed as a heading when the CTA is placed in the Stream.
  • Layout tab > Button label: Type in section.
    • This must be only the word "section", in lowercase, and nothing else. This text is what identifies the Link CTA as a section heading to the custom code, and is not displayed.
  • Layout tab > Link Action: Type in any website URL you want.
    • This URL is not displayed anywhere, but you must enter something. We suggest entering your corporate website URL.
  • Design/Placements/Variations tabs: You do not have to configure anything on these tabs, and can leave them on their default settings. The design of the CTAs is unimportant (as they will not be displayed as CTA tiles), and you will take care of placement in the next step.

After creating all the necessary section heading Link CTAs, proceed to the next step.

 

Step 4: Add Placeholder Item and Link CTAs to Stream

The last step is to add the placeholder Item and the section heading Link CTAs to the Marketing Stream that you want to divide into sections.

  1. Open the Marketing Stream that you want to divide into sections.
  2. First, add the placeholder Item to the Stream and drag-and-drop it into first position in the Stream:
  3. Now, click on the CTA button in the menu bar to add the first section heading CTA to the Stream:
  4. In the menu that appears, find the Link CTA that represents the first section heading — the topmost section heading that should appear on the page.
  5. In the lower half of the menu, check the box next to Appears After Item, and make sure the number in the field is set to 1. Also, make sure the box next to Repeat After Every is not checked.
  6. Close this menu and refresh the page (using your browser's Refresh button). The Link CTA should now appear in the Stream view in the second position (after the placeholder Item):
  7. Click on the Open button in the menu bar to preview the Stream. If everything is working correctly, you should see the section heading appear above all content Items in the Stream:

    • Not working? See the Troubleshooting section below.
  8. Now, return to the Stream Editor, and repeat steps 3-5 above to add the remaining section heading Link CTAs. Make sure to adjust the number beside Appears After Item to place the section heading in the right place in the Stream.
  9. Once you've added all section headings in the right places, you're done!

Tip

Before placing the additional section heading Link CTAs (after the first one), count the number of Items that should appear before each section heading, so that you know what to enter into the Appears After Item fields. When counting, remember to count the placeholder Item, but not the first section heading Link CTA.

 

Troubleshooting

In case it's not working as expected, here are a few things to check:

  • Is the placeholder Item published? It must not be in draft status.
  • Is the placeholder Item set to "Show"? It must not be set to "Hide" under Metadata tab > Status.
  • Is the placeholder Item in first position in the Stream? It must be in first position to ensure everything is placed correctly, and the first section heading appears at the top of the page.
  • Are both custom code blocks enabled? Both blocks must be enabled for the code within to be active.
  • Have you chosen the correct placements for the custom code blocks? The CSS block must be set to Head and the JS block must be set to Body Bottom.
  • Did you specify the correct Item ID and Stream ID in the CSS custom code block, and the Item ID in the JS custom code block? The Item ID and Stream ID specified must be the correct ones for the placeholder Item in the dedicated Stream.
  • Are the Item ID and Stream ID in the right places? Make sure they aren't switched — the Item ID is a longer string of digits.
  • Do all the section heading Link CTAs have only section set as the Button label? The text you type in here must only be section, lowercase, and nothing else.

 

What's Next

Now that you've done all the setup work and created your first sectioned Stream, it's easy to create additional sectioned Streams at any time. All you need to do is:

  1. Add the placeholder Item to any Marketing Stream to enable sections
  2. Create Link CTAs for each section heading you need
  3. Add the Link CTAs to the Stream to place the section headings

In other words, from now on, you only need to complete Step 3 and Step 4 in this guide anytime you want to create sections in any new or existing Marketing Stream.

item.title: Internal: Move Flipbook Folder to Another Account
item.description:
Objective

Please follow these steps to properly prepare for and move Flipbook Folder(s) to another account. 

 

Prep Work

  1. Write down destination name and account number
  2. Write down original location account name and account number
  3. Take note of Flipbook credits on the source account as this number will change
  4. Make sure permissions on each account match
  5. Make sure there is sufficient Flipbook credits on Destination account (the number of total Flipbooks in the folder you are migrating will match the Flipbook credits removed on the destination account)
  6. Write down the Default Custom Domains for the moving Flipbook folder (source)

 

STEPS: Move Flipbook Folder to Another Account

  1. Destination Account - Ensure that there are enough Flipbook credits. If not check to see the total # of Flipbook being moved and add it via "upload management" section.

    • Note: Destination account removes credits, original account adds back credits based on # of Flipbooks being moved.

  2. Make sure Permissions match between accounts - If they do not you'll get a warning of what is mismatched

  3. Change Default Domain of moving folder to a universal domain (eg: read.uberflip.com / www.epageflip.net)

  4. Click "Move Folder to a different Account" ("Admin Accounts only" section in the bottom-left of Flipbook folder) - you must enter the destination accounts Username (not account number)

  5. Have the custom domain moved (Jira ticket with Devops)

  6. Clear Cache Domain. https://app.uberflip.com/admins/domaincacheclear/#### (where #### is the Domain ID of the custom domain that was moved)

  7. Remove credits from Source account as they would be added back to Destination account

  8. In "Upload Management" (in the account "Services" dropdown), adjust the Uploads number to the original number of credits prior to Flipbook folder migration

  9. Test Flipbook link to make sure it loads properly/loads up and all pages are displayed

 

Additional Notes

  • Client should be made aware that the Flipbook IDs will likely change on migration, so by default the original direct-to-Flipbook URLs will be different.
  • You might run into the following error (not able to resolve the issue on the folder itself so a workaround can be used to complete the migration of the Flipbooks in the folder):
    • FAILED - Error moving Folder! Folder cannot be moved because either there are hub collections associated with it or there are folder-level apps associated with it
    • If you get this error, you can:
      1. Note the settings on the erroring folder
      2. Create a new Flipbook folder in the source account
      3. [On the new Flipbook folder] Copy all Options and Appearance settings from original erroring folder
      4. Manually move each Flipbook in the original (erroring folder) to the new folder you just created
      5. [Once all Flipbooks are in the new folder] You should now be able to migrate the new Flipbook folder without issue

item.title: Internal: Set Up A Custom Domain Without a Subdomain or Subdirectory
item.description:
Objective

The customer wants to use a custom domain for their Hub that is not part of any existing domain. This means that the domain they want:

  • Does not include a subdirectory (not Hubs-on-Dubs)
  • Does not include "www" or any other subdomain

The typical use case in this situation is that the customer wants their Hub to be a standalone website and to eliminate "www" from the URL, e.g . they want a URL for their Hub to be a naked/bare/root domain like https://myhub.com/.

Unlike a normal subdomain Hub, a customer can't set this up by themselves, so an Uberflipper will need to help them complete the process. This article outlines what you need to do.

 

Prerequisite: Advise the Customer to Contact Their DNS Provider

To set up a standalone custom domain like this, the customer must be able to create an ALIAS record (not to be confused with an A record) with their DNS provider. This is a newer type of DNS record that may not be supported by all DNS providers.

Before proceeding, you should ask the customer to contact their DNS provider and ask if they can create ALIAS records (again, this is not the same as an A record). You can proceed only if this is possible. (Note also that some DNS providers may use a different name for this type of record.)

 

Step 1: Create the Custom Domain

The customer can complete this step themselves, but it's recommended that you do so for them. This is because the domain must initially be created with "www" (which is only removed in Step 2), which can be confusing for the customer.

Important

You must create the domain from within the customer's Hub, not using the internal Uberflip Admin backend: if you use the Admin backend, it will not be possible to enable SSL on the domain.

  1. Log in to the customer's Hub as an admin.
  2. Navigate to Account Settings > Services > Domains and click on Add a Domain to create a new domain.
    • For detailed instructions, see this article.
  3. Although the customer wants a URL without "www", make sure to include "www" when creating the domain, as the tool will reject any URL without a subdomain.
    • e.g. if the customer wants https://myhub.com/, you must create https://www.myhub.com/
  4. When you have created the domain in the customer's account, move on to the next step.

 

Step 2: Open an Ops Ticket

Since you had to create the custom domain with "www" in it, an Ops ticket is necessary to remove it from the domain.

  1. Log in to Jira.
  2. On the left, click on the + button.
  3. In the Create issue window that appears, choose "Infra/Ops (OPS)" under Project.
  4. Fill in the Summary and Description fields, leaving everything else as default (including blanks):
    • For Summary, enter something like "Remove www. from custom domain"
    • In the Description field, provide details about the customer and domain that.
  5. Click on Create. Ops will notify you once the custom domain has been modified as requested.
  6. Once you have confirmation from Ops, proceed to the next step.

 

Step 3: Ask the Customer to Create an ALIAS Record

At this stage, you can notify the customer that they can now update their DNS to point the custom domain at read.uberflip.com, as per the normal procedure.

However, there is one important difference: in the normal procedure, a customer would create a CNAME record. In this case, that is not possible, as you cannot create CNAME record for a naked domain (a domain without www or any other subdomain).

Instead, advise the customer to create an ALIAS record. This is a newer type of DNS record that works like a CNAME record, but can be created for a naked domain. It is otherwise set up exactly the same way as a CNAME record.

Once this is done, the customer can proceed with the normal subdomain setup procedure to complete the setup.

 

Additional Notes

There are two reasons why this modified process is necessary:

  • All new Hub domains should have SSL, but you can only set up a custom domain with SSL by creating it within the customer's Hub interface. This interface requires a subdomain to successfully create a Hub. As a result, the custom domain must be set up with a subdomain, which we must then manually remove internally.
  • The setup process used is the same as for a subdomain, which requires setting up a CNAME record with the customer's DNS provider. CNAME records can't coexist with any other type of records, so they can't be created for the root domain (as this would interfere with e.g. the A record for the domain). Instead, an alternative type of record (the ALIAS) record must be used.

 var query = window.location.search.substring(1);

 if (pair[0] == variable) {
 return pair[1];
 }
 }
 return (false);
}

 if ($.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie')) {

 });

 if ($.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie')) {
 
 $.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie', null, {
 expires: -1
 });
 }
}
